api_contracts.description: Returns a simple Hello World greeting message

component_logic.responsibility: Handles GET /hello requests and returns Hello World response with timestamp

interfaces.description: Returns Hello World response with current timestamp
Formats response with message, timestamp, and status

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use datetime.utcnow().isoformat() + 'Z' for ISO 8601 UTC timestamp. Return exactly 'Hello World' as message. Include status field set to 'success'. Handle any exceptions and return 500 error. Use FastAPI route decorator @app.get('/hello').

design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: API contract must use GET method for /hello endpoint. Response must be JSON format with consistent structure.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify proper error handling for unexpected failures
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Component must handle exceptions and return 500 status code. No unhandled exceptions should crash the application.
Response must always include message, timestamp, and status fields. Message must be exactly 'Hello World'. Timestamp must be valid ISO 8601 format.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify endpoint has minimal processing overhead
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Handler should execute in under 10ms. No database calls or external API calls. Simple string formatting only.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify no sensitive information is exposed
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Response must not include server details, internal paths, or system information. Only return specified message, timestamp, and status.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify component mapping to semantic units
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloWorldHandler component must be linked to SU-001. All semantic units from project plan must have corresponding components.

architecture_overview: Simple single-endpoint REST API with minimal architecture. HelloWorldHandler component processes GET requests to /hello endpoint and returns static greeting with dynamic timestamp. No database or external dependencies required. FastAPI framework provides HTTP server capabilities and automatic JSON serialization.
assumptions: No authentication or authorization required for hello endpoint
Response format includes timestamp for request tracking
UTC timezone used for all timestamps
No rate limiting required for simple hello endpoint
No logging requirements specified beyond error handling
